thread.title: Ultra4 Championships bringing new track to N. Nevada
thread.title_full: Ultra4 Championships bringing new track to N. Nevada

title: Ultra4 Championships bringing new track to N. Nevada
text: Share Updated: 10/14 9:53 pm SPARKS, Nev. (MyNews4.com & KRNV) -- Crews are gearing up for the Ultra4 Racing National Championships this weekend in northern Nevada, and officials say the track will be one of the toughest in the country.Over the last several weeks, Q&D Construction worked to transform the track at the Wild West Motorsports Park, which features boulders, steep inclines and declines and big jumps."I was hear last year; it was the first year they had the championships here," driver Alex Hardaway told News 4. "It was an epic event, and they've made a lot of improvements to the track to make it better this year."Ultra4 features limited 4-wheel drive racing on a wide variety of terrain. The top Ultra4 racers in the country will compete for $10,000 and the title of national champion on Friday and Saturday at Wild West.To learn more about the event and to purchase tickets, click here .
